text: hey everyone thomas joseph here with a
kitchen conundrum that you've asked
about and that is making ganache
now ganache is one of my favorite things
and it is so simple it's two ingredients
and that is chocolate and cream but the
real trick is in knowing the ratio of
cream and chocolate and what the outcome
will be
so in front of me here I have three
different versions of ganache and
they're used in three very different
ways now we all love truffles and if
you're going to make truffles or
anything like that you're going to need
a specific ratio of chocolate to cream
so for truffles that's two parts
chocolate to one part cream so that's
eight ounces of chocolate to four ounces
of cream if you wanted to make a rich
chocolate frosting that you could use in
layer cakes or to frost cupcakes like I
have here you need an equal ratio of
cream to chocolate so that's four ounces
of chocolate in this case and four
ounces or a half cup of heavy cream if
you wanted something like a nice
chocolaty glaze for cupcakes for a bundt
cake or a loaf you would need to reduce
the amount of chocolate or up the amount
of cream so that is a one part chocolate
to two parts cream so in this case it's
four ounces of chocolate to eight ounces
of cream which is a full cup of heavy
cream I'm gonna show you today how to
make truffles but if you wanted to
change it up and you wanted to make
something else a different type of
ganache now you know how it's the same
technique it's just different weighted
measurements so I need 8 ounces of
chocolate and today I'm using a
semi-sweet chocolate and that is 61%
cocoa and that's important to know when
you're making ganache as well you want
to make sure that you're using the right
percentage of chocolate because milk
chocolate or white chocolate has a lower
amount of cocoa in it so I need 8 ounces
of this and I'm using a serrated knife
here to chip away the chocolate whenever
you're cutting chocolate into pieces a
serrated knife is best this was a 12
ounce block here so I'm gonna just see
if I'm in the right direction so this
should be good now what you need to do
is continue to chop the chocolate until
it
pretty much uniform in size you don't
want big pieces and little pieces
because what's gonna happen is it's not
going to melt evenly when you pour the
hot cream over your chocolate so now I'm
gonna transfer my chocolate to a glass
bowl a deep glass bowl and I'm just
going to weigh it out so I have my 8
ounces of chocolate and now I need to
heat the cream so I have 4 ounces of
heavy cream I'm gonna transfer this to a
pot and bring this up to a simmer so now
I'm gonna take my scalded cream here
pour it over my chocolate give the bowl
a little bit of a shake and let this sit
for about five to 10 minutes and what
that does is it lets the chocolate melt
evenly if you stirred it now what would
happen is the mixture would cool down
quickly and you'd have chunks of
unmelted chocolate in your ganache now
you can see the chocolate has melted
evenly and all you have to do is whisk
it until it's nicely combined with the
heavy cream and now for truffles scrape
this into a flat dish a flat shallow
dish like a pie plate is great smooth it
out and then this goes into the
refrigerator now for 30 minutes until
it's nice and firm and we can shape them
into truffles so the ganache has been in
the refrigerator for about 30 minutes
it's nice and firm and I'm using a small
ice cream scoop here use a little bit of
pressure here a little bit of force and
you should be able to create a nice
sized scoop of the ganache and I'm going
to just portion out the ganache onto a
parchment lined baking sheet and this
recipe makes about one and a half dozen
but it ultimately depends on what size
ice cream scoop or melon baller that you
use I'm going to take my portioned out
truffles they go into the refrigerator
until they're nice and firm so that's
gonna take about ten minutes and then
I'm going to shape them and coat them in
cocoa powder so our truffles have been
in the refrigerator for about ten
minutes they're nice and firm and all
you have to do is roll them into a ball
and drop it into some cocoa powder shake
the bowl around a little bit you could
also use chopped nuts here you could use
would be great confectioner sugar so
there you have it a rich wonderful tasty
treat chocolate ganache is one of those
great things to put in your back pocket
one recipe three different ways endless
possibilities enjoy
